data.title: Working At Whitworth University: Company Overview and Culture
data.meta_description: Learn about working at Whitworth University from employee reviews and detailed data on culture, salaries, demographics, management, financial, and more.
data.text:
Whitworth University overview

Industry

Education

Revenue

Headquarters

Employees

1,051

Founded In

Organization Type

Education

For a private, liberal arts education integrated with Christian principles, the Whitworth University in Spokane, Washington, is a great choice. It is affiliated with the United States Presbyterian Church and honors its commitment to the Christian mission by producing graduates guided by intellectual inquiry and service to God, Christ, and the community. Instructors are dedicated Christian scholars, infusing education with Christian values to provide students with an education in both the mind and spirit. Academics offered at the university include over 55 undergraduate and graduate degree programs, like Community Engagement and Transformation, Cross-Cultural Studies, Piano Performance, Psychology and many more. The university contains many spiritual and student life resources. Students may partake in a number of the university's church relations, including the Center for Faith and Learning, outreach activities, the Whitworth Institute of Ministry, and more. Study abroad programs are available for students looking to gain global real-world experiences. Whitworth also offers a rich number of educational support services like academic planning, career exploration, individual counseling, tutoring and more. The Whitworth Health and Counseling center provides students with high quality, confidential care based on students' needs. Applications are available online with no fee at the school's admissions website. To be considered for all types of financial aid, students must submit the FAFSA application by March 1 for incoming freshman, May 1 for continuing students, and July 1 for transfer students.

The staff at Whitworth University come from unusually diverse demographic backgrounds. The organization is 53.2% female and 28.9% ethnic minorities. Despite its diversity in other areas, Whitworth University employees are noticeably lacking in political diversity. It has an unusually high proportion of employees who are members of the Democratic Party, at 88.0%. Employees seem to enjoy working in an otherwise diverse workplace that is dominated by members of the Democratic Party. Whitworth University has great employee retention with staff members usually staying with the organization for 3.8 years.The average employee at Whitworth University makes $32,185 per year. Pay at Whitworth University is significantly lower than some of its highest paying competitors, like Seattle University, Gonzaga University, and Montreat College, which pay $59,023, $46,279, and $46,276, respectively.

A large education organization with 1,051 employees and an annual revenue of $77.0M, Whitworth University is headquartered in Spokane, WA.
